alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 2:29PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong, heavy thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kanawha and Boone Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong, heavy thunderstorm over Madison, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Madison, Marmet, Julian, Van, Danville, Whitesville, Sylvester, Seth, Turtle Creek, Prenter, Ashford, Foster, Racine, and Jeffrey. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 89 and 91. Route 119 between mile markers 45 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
